intro: Wigandia urens, commonly known as the "yellow bignonia," is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Additionally, it has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
